short_term: Improved time management and better handling of coursework through the development of study routines.
Begin to see slight improvements in coding skills due to focused efforts.
long_term: Establish a solid academic foundation, potentially leading to internships or co-op opportunities in tech or related fields.
Gain clarity on career path, possibly exploring graduate studies or specialized training.

short_term: Forming a stable social circle, reducing feelings of disconnection.
Engage in college events or clubs to alleviate social anxiety and expand network.
long_term: Develop deeper, long-lasting friendships and potentially romantic relationships.
Learn to balance social life with academic commitments, leading to personal growth and maturity.

short_term: Establish a consistent sleep schedule, possibly with the help of college health services.
Explore campus resources for mental health support to manage stress and anxiety.
long_term: Incorporate regular physical activity into routine, leading to better overall health.
Develop strategies for stress management, potentially reducing the impact of weather changes on mood.

short_term: Start budgeting more effectively, possibly using apps or financial planning tools.
Look for part-time work or on-campus jobs to supplement income.
long_term: Gain financial independence by securing scholarships, grants, or part-time employment.
Begin to understand and manage student loans, credit, and savings for post-college life.

short_term: Engage in philosophical discussions or join a campus group that aligns with personal values and interests.
Explore different philosophies and ideologies to better understand personal identity.
long_term: Develop a more defined personal philosophy, possibly influencing career choices or lifestyle decisions.
Engage in deeper self-reflection, leading to a more authentic sense of self and purpose.

short_term: Resolve ongoing coding challenges through peer tutoring or online resources.
Improve proficiency with necessary software and tools for coursework.
long_term: Become adept in using technology for academic and personal projects, potentially leading to participation in hackathons or tech-related events.
Develop a strong foundation in computer science or related technology fields, preparing for future career opportunities.
